newsitem.title: FRANCE: E.Europe - 5 seen with 750,000 t. 2005 sugar surplus.
newsitem.headline: E.Europe - 5 seen with 750,000 t. 2005 sugar surplus.

text.p: A sugar surplus of 750,000 tonnes is projected by 2005 in five central European countries seeking EU membership, the European Commission said.
The five countries -- Poland, Hungary, the Czech Republic, Slovakia and Slovenia -- are members of the Central European Free Trade Area (CEFTA).
The expected sugar surplus, even though production would be stabilised by production quotas, would increase a growing EU-15 sugar excess of 3.5 million tonnes.

But in "Agenda 2000" on the challenge of EU enlargement, the Commission cautioned that the CEFTA rate of surplus production may not be sustainable in view of the relatively high cost of sugar production and continuing overcapacity in the processing sector.
